author: {'steamid': '76561197972860008', 'num_games_owned': 1719, 'num_reviews': 242, 'playtime_forever': 2033, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2011, 'last_played': 1709482931}
review:
[h1] AT A GLANCE [/h1]
(Full review follows below)

[list]
[*][b] Game Name: [/b] Fortix 2
[*][b] Original Release: [/b] 2011-05-06
[*][b] Genre Tags: [/b] Casual, Logic, Puzzle
[*][b] Estimated Playtime (Campaign): [/b] 7-8 hours
[*][b] 100% Achievements Playtime: [/b] 18-20 hours
[*][b] DLC Required for 100% Achievements: [/b] No
[*][b] Multiplayer Aspect: [/b] None
[*][b] Replayability: [/b] Some
[*][b] Recommended To: [/b] Casual Gamers, Achievement Hunters
[/list]

[h1] REVIEW [/h1]
[b] Fortix 2[/b] is a casual, logic puzzle game. It is the second game in the Fortix series.

The game mechanics have you try and take over as much of the board as possible and avoid all the other creatures or obstacles. You can capture or remove enemies from the board by having them on the side that is captured.

The game is not that complicated until you attempt ‚Äúimpossible‚Äù difficulty. Some of these maps will require multiple playthroughs in order to get a perfect rating. Play time for this game is ~7-8 hours to complete the main campaign on a single difficulty, ~18-20 if you want to 100% every difficulty and ~18-20 hours to get all achievements. Achievement hunting requires playing the game over and over at different difficulties. Impossible must be done with a perfect rating, and is by far what will take a bulk of your time grinding. The game has no replayability, unless you are just nostalgic for the game and want to beat it all again. I recommend this game to anyone that likes casual puzzle games or is an achievement hunter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009324469', 'num_games_owned': 475, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1714, 'last_played': 1700780339}
review:
6.0/10
Prepare to use these arrows keys!

Gameplay : 7/10 (Repetitive but hide some cute bonus content)
Story : 5/10 (None except some screen text for new enemies)
Music : 6/10 (Simple Fantasy Backgound Music) (+1 for sound effect when you capture enemies... ooff.. got you !)
Graphics : 5/10 (Drawing of each region is cute and immersive but that's it)
Replayability : 7/10 (After beating impossible mode you'll want to stay away from this game)

Pro
- The learning curve is not steap and if a good challenge if you want to do it at 100% Satisfaction guaranteed.

Con
- The powerup does help a bit but there's no way to make them last longer or upgrade them (That would make the game too easy, so it's OK then....)

Tips : Use the keyboard for quick come back on your line and do little steps at the time to conquer that dragon master...whatever it's name.

author: {'steamid': '76561198831451273', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1701355873}
review: Fortix 2 is an accessible and enjoyable arcade game, perfect for casual players. It provides hours of replayability with numerous levels to conquer. However, it doesn't offer much innovation in terms of gameplay and strategies compared to the first Fortix. While it retains the charm and simplicity of its predecessor, it might feel familiar and lacking a fresh twist for those who've played the original. Despite this, for players looking for a classic arcade experience with updated visuals, Fortix 2 still offers solid entertainment and a chance to conquer territory in an enchanting fantasy world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027862666', 'num_games_owned': 1201, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1943, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1943, 'last_played': 1643195945}
review:
Game description is wrong, its not reverse turret defense game! Its Qix(arcade game from 1981) or better known as Xonix(DOS 1984) inspired game(i wont call it clone it have many added elements).


[b]What i like:[/b]
Looks and sound good.
Easy to pick up hard to master.
Really old game conspect but with added elements(its pretty much what you see is what you get, so some may find it boring)
Can play with low end PC.
Can be really challenging. 
Steam Cloud support.
Have decent amount of content.
Cheap but feels like real game(you can buy much worse "games" from Steam).
I didnt have technical problems(except Leaderboards).

[b]What i dislike:[/b]
Can be sometimes more frustating than challenging.
Dont have restart button(you can restart from menu and its wont take much time but with impossible difficulty i restarted many times and wish it have it).
Later levels contain 2 or 3 castles you need to complete row in one sitting, if you complete these once(per difficulty) you can play each individually(but impossible or zombie mode it can be pain).
Looks like game is abandoned by developers so if you have problems you probably wont get any help.
Leaderboards crash game(it was reported years ago but not fixed).

[b]Achievements(if you care :P):[/b]

Not bad, impossible perfect and zombie mode can be hard. Capture 300 dragons you probably dont get by end of game and need to grind but its not hard and wont take too much time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002506911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 412, 'playtime_forever': 2069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2069, 'last_played': 1624329933}
review:
Finally came around to coming back to this game.  I've owned it for years and enjoyed the original time I played it.  Came back to complete all achievements, and it's still addicting, even with the simple gameplay.

This game plays like a phone app, but yet it's still fun on the PC.  You are a soldier and you taking back the land from dragons, trolls, and other evil creatures.  You must capture or destroy the turrets and take over the coat of arms to beat each level.  In each level you must make a path and connect to your safe area in order to add a new area as a safe area.  Kind of hard to explain, but you start on the perimeter of your screen with just an outline that is safe, and as you make a path that forms a box, rectangle, or any geometric shape and reconnect to the original perimeter or safe zone, it absorbs that area and it is added to the safe zone.  Once you have taken up the entirety of the screen as a safe zone, you win the level.

It gets progressively hard.  At first it's monsters walking around and turrets firing fire arrows.  Then it's dragons and then the fire arrows turn into magical arrows that follow you as you move around.  Then the dragons start following you rather than flying a random flight pattern. Then the dragons spit fire.  It gets progressively hard, and walls appear that you can just walk through, so you need to build a safe space around them.

During the game, a star will show up giving you bonuses.  It can add time to your level, as you need to beat the level within a certain amount of time.  It adds lives, as you only have a certain amount of lives in each level, it speeds up your movement, freezes dragons and other monsters, freezes the towers from firing, allows you to fly over walls, gives you a shield so you are invincible fora while, and more.  Using these correctly can make or break a level, but because they are random, sometimes you find yourself running around the whole level just to get an extra life instead of what you were looking for.

I beat the game fairly easily, but came back to get the achievements which require a perfect on all levels in impossible difficulty.  This was tough and tested my patience.  The game is random for better and for worse, so it's to know when a tower will fire or which direction a dragon will move next when it hits an edge.

Overall, it's not a AAA game, but definitely worth some time playing just to check it out.  I enjoyed it and was entertained, try it, you might be too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012221863', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 253, 'playtime_forever': 1232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1202, 'last_played': 1694430992}
review: Its a fun territory capture game, definitely worth picking up. The only downsides are that the power-ups are utterly random as well as the starting position and movement of all monster enemies. Beyond that though, it has a ton of replayability and different game modes. Normal, classic, zombie normal and zombie classic. So definitely one to recommend, bar the random powerups.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023933693', 'num_games_owned': 422, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1055, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1052, 'last_played': 1621705375}
review:
With the first Fortix iteration Nemesys Games gave Taito's original take on the arcadey "capture" puzzler a fantasy spin and took advantage of the setting in favor of a couple mechanics twists, like capturing catapults or using conquered territory as cover against watchtowers' fire--in a way adding a layer of tower-defensing to the long forgotten formula. It never achieves Qix's level of tension (much due to the original's unmatchable surreal sci-fi thematic), but it fares well enough in what it was intended to--even if the Flash indie aesthetics don't get to sell it well.

Fortix 2 builds upon every corner of its predecessor's foundation, and it's mostly for the better: the game's presentation (and overall mood) is still casual, but several notches up regarding art direction; new enemies/power-ups are introduced at a more fine-tuned pace, lending the game a solid feel to the experience as a whole; and the same can be said about levels design, with the handcrafted walls/keys mechanics--despite the fact those sacrifice some of the player's freedom in favor of a more heavy-handed gameplay flow.

On top of the meatier main game, the extra content is what really makes Fortix 2 unmissable for players interested in such a specific premise. Several difficulty settings (with specific related achievements), an extra hidden mode that changes the gameplay in meaniful ways, valuable Steam Trading Cards, plus the entire first game (reskinned with the modern assets) available as a post-game unlockable make Fortix 2's value hard to pass.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960931103', 'num_games_owned': 483, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 1247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1247, 'last_played': 1611287075}
review:
[b]Pros[/b]
+60FPS
+Multiple difficulties
+Classic levels included
+Easy gameplay concept
+Variety of power-ups
+Good achievements

[b]Cons[/b]
+Can feel repetitive about half way through
+Frustrating zombie levels

First type of puzzle game I‚Äôve played like this and it was pretty good. You move your character to draw shapes inside a map and when your line connects to another part, you capture the shape. Do this enough times destroying the required number of turrets and capture points to advance to the next level. 

The game description, like other reviewers have mentioned, isn‚Äôt accurate as a ‚Äúreverse turret defense‚Äù. But regardless, it is a fun game and I spent a decent amount of time finishing it. Fortix 2 can get difficult. About half way through I realized I was playing on the ‚Äúeasy‚Äù difficulty level! Must be the default. I don‚Äôt think I would want a tougher challenge but it has 3 more, up to ‚Äúimpossible‚Äù, good luck!

There are also 15 original Fortix levels you can play as well as a zombie mode. Zombie mode requires you to capture all the graves in a level. This time, however, zombies will continually spawn out of the graves until you capture them AND they can hurt you on the baseline (the border of the territory you claim, which typically makes you invincible). This is a tough mode and I only got about half way through before it was just a time sink with a little bit of power-up luck to complete the levels. 

Speaking of power-ups, there is a small variety of power-ups to help you. These pop up randomly in a level. Examples are: Invincibility, stop enemies, stop turrets, go faster, etc. These are temporary and only last several seconds so use your time wisely. 

[b]Conclusion[/b]
Not a bad little puzzle game. Can be very challenging but doable (at least on lower difficulties). There are a few grindy achievements but most of them are fun to get. I enjoyed my time with Fortix 2, it doesn‚Äôt show anything spectacular but is still a solid puzzle game. 

[b]5/10[/b] Average

author: {'steamid': '76561197996273719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 797, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1386194955}
review:
[h1] Information / Review English [/h1]

Fortix 2 is an arcade fantasy game developed by Nemesys Games.

[h1] Gameplay / Story [/h1]

Your task is to draw rectangles in the picture until you have reduced the original rectangle so much that you win the game and thus push back your enemies and thus gradually recapture the country. But this is not always easy, because when you draw, bats, fire arrows, cannonballs, death dragons and other nasty attacks attack - if the projectile or enemy touch the hero or his unfinished line, you lose a life. To make matters worse, different surfaces such as seas or forests affect the hero's running speed and some walls block his way. Then he first has to isolate keys so that gates open. Elsewhere, he can fence in guns that automatically fire at enemy towers. In the end, you don't have to occupy the majority of the map, but conquer certain, well-guarded points - a successful extension of the concept.

[h1] Pro [/h1]

+ Child-friendly
+ Challenge comes first
+ various difficulties, not too easy and not too difficult
+ Bonus goals for point hunters
+ several control options
+ Achievements and trading cards

[h1] Contra [/h1]

- Manageable number of levels
- entertains little more than a few minutes

[h1] Conclusion [/h1]

Fortix 2 is again a successful, simple puzzle game for young and old, which is difficult to master.


[h1] Information / Review Deutsch [/h1]

Fortix 2 ist ein Arcade-Fantasy Spiel, welches von Nemesys Games entwickelt wurde. 

[h1] Gameplay / Geschichte [/h1]

Deine Aufgabe besteht darin, Rechtecke in das Bild einzuzeichnen, bis man das urspr√ºngliche Rechteck so stark verkleinert hat, dass man den Sieg einstreicht und so mit deine Feinde zur√ºck zu dr√§ngen und so das Land nach und nach zur√ºckzuerobern. Dies ist aber nicht immer einfach, da wenn man zeichnet, attackieren Flederm√§use, Feuerpfeile, Kanonenkugeln, Todesdrachen und andere Gemeinheiten - ber√ºhren Projektil oder Feind den Helden oder seine unvollendete Linie, verliert man ein Leben. Zu allem √úberfluss beeinflussen verschiedene Untergr√ºnde wie Meere oder W√§lder des Helden Laufgeschwindigkeit und manche Mauer versperrt ihm glatt den Weg. Dann muss er zun√§chst Schl√ºssel eingrenzen, damit sich Tore √∂ffnen. Anderswo kann er Gesch√ºtze einz√§unen, die automatisch auf feindliche T√ºrme feuern. Am Ende muss man nicht der Gro√üteil der Karte einnehmen, sondern bestimmte, gut bewachte Punkte erobern - eine gelungene Erweiterung des Konzepts.

[h1] Pro [/h1]

+ Kinderfreundlich
+ Herausforderung steht an erster Stelle
+ verschiedene Schwierigkeiten, nicht zu leicht und nicht zu schwer
+ Bonusziele f√ºr Punktej√§ger
+ mehrere Steuerungsm√∂glichkeiten
+ Errungenschaften und Trading Cards

[h1] Kontra [/h1]

- √ºberschaubare Anzahl an Levels
- unterh√§lt kaum mehr als wenige Minuten

[h1] Fazit [/h1]

Fortix 2 ist bietet dir wieder ein gelungenes einfaches Denkspiel f√ºr jung und alt, welches aber schwer zu meistern ist.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969104129', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1600475337}
review:
Very relaxing to play, no timer harassing you, you can play it very conservatively to the point it feels like you're cheating, but in a good way, where the game rewards you for it.

The simplest way to describe it is pleasant comforting experience that one can enjoy while listening to podcasts / watching TV / voice chatting. It's one of those in-the-background games that's satisfying to play with minimal strategy to keep you engaged and entertained.

I could see myself buying 1000s of more levels if available and continue a pleasant ritual of visiting it every evening when listening to my news / podcasts.

P.S. Another genre that offers an alternate example to this in-the-background gaming is racing (to me at least)

So to conclude, it's highly recommended, you'll hopefully be surprised of how entertaining this game is.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998568769', 'num_games_owned': 669, 'num_reviews': 818, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1584369913}
review:
[i] My Experience [/i]

Well, I wish I would've purchased Fortix 2 before I purchased the original game. Fortix 2 includes the levels from the original game, and renders them in a more pleasing visual format. Even if it were only the first game with revamped graphics, for two dollars instead of one, it would be worth a purchase.

However, a few of the new Fortix 2 levels are worth playing as well, which makes it a more lucrative package. Unfortunately, many of the later levels in Fortix 2 are an absolute chore. Instead of providing the player with multiple approaches and possible strategies, many of the later levels must be approached in a very specific way. There are many impassible walls that you are forced to go around, and doors that must be opened in a certain order by collecting various keys.

Despite these gripes, the core gameplay remains engaging. I enjoy slowing cordoning off the map, and find it satisfying in much the same way I did with Jezzball in the Microsoft Entertainment Pack of old. If you haven't purchased either game yet, you only need Fortix 2 (as I mentioned earlier). This series scratches quite a unique casual gaming itch that I haven't had scratched in quite some time.

[h1]Esta rese√±a no contiene spoilers[/h1]

Despu√©s de la buena recepci√≥n del primer t√≠tulo, Nemesys Games decidi√≥ sacar su segunda parte un a√±o despu√©s. El sistema jugable es exactamente el mismo, por lo que si te gust√≥ la primera parte esta segunda a buen seguro te gustar√° igualmente, o incluso m√°s porque mejoran, y mucho, ciertos aspectos del t√≠tulo.

En esta ocasi√≥n nuestro h√©roe partir√° a la isla de Artalom para derrotar al malvado mago Xitrof. En este aspecto el juego no var√≠a demasiado con respecto al primer Fortix, siendo el argumento una mera excusa para presentar los niveles. Como en la vez anterior no es algo molesto porque nos sirve para tener una base m√≠nima argumentativa, y para este tipo de juegos es m√°s que suficiente.

Lo que si mejora, y en gran medida, es el aspecto gr√°fico del juego. Se pasa de un cierto realismo en sus fondos a un nivel algo m√°s desenfadado, con unos colores m√°s v√≠vidos, unos modelados del entorno y los enemigos, los cuales son m√°s variados, m√°s trabajados y un aspecto global gr√°fico bastante m√°s simp√°tico y cercano.

A su vez el dise√±o de niveles tambi√©n experimenta una sensible mejor√≠a, jugando mucho mejor con el terreno. Con terrenos m√°s abruptos y elaborados que provocar√°n que tengamos que tener cuidado respecto a c√≥mo vamos a afrontar la situaci√≥n seg√∫n como sea el nivel.

Como pasaba en su primera parte, el personajes anda normal por terrenos de tierra planos, pero si entraba en el agua se ralentizaba en gran medida. En su primera parte esto no se explotaba completamente para complicarle la vida al jugador, pero en esta segunda parte s√≠ se utiliza para provocar que cambiemos la manera de afrontar las adversidades.

En lo que respecta a su nivel sonoro, el juego sigue presentando un nivel m√°s que adecuado, con buenos efectos de sonido y buenas melod√≠as medievales.

En lo tocante a su duraci√≥n, el juego sigue los pasos de su antecesor, brind√°ndonos unas 10-12 horas de entretenimiento si nos disponemos a acabarlo completamente con todos los requisitos.

En resumen, si en su d√≠a jugaste a Fortix y te gust√≥, aqu√≠ tienes m√°s y mejor. Si por el contrario no te sedujo la idea es poco probable que te interese su oferta jugable, a menos que el aspecto gr√°fico sea un plus para ti y lo veas con nuevos ojos, pero como tal la jugabilidad es la misma aunque algo m√°s elaborada.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095457768', 'num_games_owned': 185, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1543101432}
review: I honestly didn't expect much from this game, having gotten it from a generic 10x Steam Keys sale on G2A. Out of the 10 games I received, I enjoyed this one the most. The game requires very little computer resources, but still looks great. There are no 3D components to this game which is respectable, but still is tons of fun to play when you are bored or just looking for a break from other games. Overall, I think this is a great game, and is worth the $2 I DIDN'T pay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040051009', 'num_games_owned': 1888, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 941, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 965, 'last_played': 1374743516}
review:
[b][Achievement Review for Achievements Hunters][/b]

A sequel to the awesome Fortix, although in his first delivery it only took 8 hours to get the 100%, this time it will take twice as long, approximately 16 hours.

It's still so good, but this time things will be a bit more difficult since it asks you to finish all the levels perfectly in the maximum difficulty "impossible" but again nothing of another world for a Hunter with something of experience, you will only need to retry until you manage to win, never surrender.

This time you will also have a grinding achievement but it is not so terrible, you should only capture 300 dragons, so it is an easy and fun game to complete.

[b]Summary:
Difficulty: 2 / 5
Fun to Complete: 4 / 5
Time to Complete: 15-16 Hours[/b]

[b][url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/31104649/]Follow my Curator's page to see more of my achievements reviews[/url][/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198067227433', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1509830905}
review:
THIS IS NOT A REVERSED TOWER DEFENSE GAME. In any way. 

Honestly, the game could deserve a positive review for what it is: a casual arcade game which can entertain you for a little while if you don't want to dive into a real game. The pricing is also very decent, so that Fortix 2 is not yet another example of crap game which abounds on Steam, the first and foremost merit of which being that they cost less than a coffee.

So, why a negative review? Only because the description of the game is misleading and it turns out to be very, very disappointing: no, this game is not a "reversed Tower Defense". I have searched for long such a "reversed Tower Defense" game where you can send your army on a path full of killing towers to reach some core, and this is nowhere near this. 

You control a character which is apparently a king (leading an assault by itself) on the edges of a rectangle. Within the rectangle there are victory pinpoints, towers, monsters. Your goal is to encapsulate in a closed contour anything you want to conquer (means you win the victory pinpoints and the monsters and towers are respectively killed and destroyed); but if anything (i.e. monsters or cannon balls shot from the towers) touch the line on which you are before you close the contour, you die.

As you can see it's a very simplistic arcade game. It's decent for what it is, but the promise stirred up by the description left me with a sense of disappointment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013619910', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1508059441}
review:
A revisitation of the old arcade game Qix. There are a few additions to the gameplay but not enough to make it interesting for more than a few levels. 

The graphics and music are nothing worth remembering.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11092, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1483322653}
review:
Fortix 2 is a ripoff of 1983's Styx from Windmill games.   Sure, there's some mediocre artwork beneath it which Styx lacked, and a couple of wacky "additions" to the gameplay, but ultimately not much has changed since then.   

Except for 34 years of gaming industry advancement, which Fortix 2 doesn't bother benefitting from. 

So you have this ripoff of an 1983 game with gameplay not really any different or better.    You have a tablet interface that's been ported tolerably enough to work with mouse or keyboard (ok).   You have one fixed resolution and no serious game settings, just volume and fullscreen (that's how we know it's a tablet game).   That and the fixed non-16:9 resolution.  I can only imagine how terrible it would look for people who bought ultrawide monitors thinking the gaming industry would bother catering to them. 

So, too many reasons not to like this and not enough reasons for a 1983 game derivative to be paid for on Steam.  Thumbs down, play Styx for free online.

review:
The object of this game is to draw boxes around things without getting hit by other things. Whilst this may sound simple, it isn't, especially on impossible mode. 

Fortix 2 carries on from the first game by adding more enemies, more levels, and also allows you to play the classic game. 

It's a simple game done right.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036328736', 'num_games_owned': 3945, 'num_reviews': 726, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1478684474}
review:
Comme dans le premier opus sorti an plus t√¥t, le but du jeu est de conqu√©rir petit √† petit un territoire en tra√ßant une ligne pour cr√©er successivement plusieurs petites zones conquises. Il faut finir les niveaux dans le temps imparti en √©vitant des ennemis volants et des projectiles. On peut d√©clancher des catapultes pour d√©truire les d√©fenses adverses ou exterminer les monstres pi√©g√©s dans les zones captur√©es. On peut obtenir des bonus pour nous faciliter la t√¢che.
Bref, les seules modifications par rapport √† Fortix 1, ce sont les graphismes et des changements mineurs dans l'environnement qui ne modifient que peu le gameplay.

Un jeu donc toujours bien sympa disponible en 4 niveaux de difficult√© (choisir le plus √©lev√© pour avoir un peu de challenge) qui permet de passer un bon moment bien qu'assez court. Mais au prix o√π il est vendu, c'est cadeau.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999217003', 'num_games_owned': 2566, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1609195284}
review:
[h1]THIS GAME SCORES [0 1 | 2 *3*] = ~88% (75%-100%)[/h1]

Fortix 2 is a good implementation of the game concept of [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qix]Qix[/url] or [url=https://www.c64-wiki.de/index.php/Stix_(Supersoft)]Stix[/url] (The latter has animated GIFs.) where you have to conquer parts of a 2D level (e.g. image) by surrounding them (Whatever shape/size you decide.) with a line. You draw the line with a little "cursor" (The player avatar.) that ventures into the hostile area and then returns to the baseline or to the border of already conquered parts of the level.

This is a casual game, and it will take you only a few hours to beat it. Replay value is medium, means you can well return to this after a few months and enjoy it again without a story that you already know getting in the way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011877544', 'num_games_owned': 777, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 1214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1214, 'last_played': 1469024346}
review:
Great game, especially when compared to the first one.
The mechanics are changed up, you instead have to capture "Dark Badges" and destroy all the towers in any given level to beat it.
There's all the monsters you originally encountered from the first game, plus the red dragon - which is a step up from the green dragon - and the blood bat cave.
The art style is much different, and looks a lot better.
In the game, there's three different regions on the island you're trying to claim, a foresty region, a snowy region, and a volcnao region, each one has their own unique towers walls, projectiles, and overall look. In addition, there's two different tracks for each of these regions, which helps a lot in making sure you don't hear the same song over and over again while you're making your way through the 30 levels.

Overall, if you liked the first game, or prefer a nice, casual game in a fantasy setting, I definitely recommend purchasing this game, especially given the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047536700', 'num_games_owned': 959, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1547690545}
review:
I'd give it a thumbs sideways if possible. It's not a terrible game, it just wasn't as fun as I had hoped. 

Basically you get what you see from the trailer video. If you're a fan of games like Qix, you'll probably get some enjoyment while playing it. That said, I don't think there is a lot of (fun) replayability. Besides being repetitive, I found myself having less fun as it went on. Mostly due to it being tedious by the end, having to inch your way forward due to the sheer amount of dragons/turret shots. There just wasn't enough varying gameplay to keep me interested and excited for the next level. TLDR; I got bored.

I mean the game is $2 and often bundled, so if the trailer intrigues you then I say yeah, go ahead and play it. Otherwise you're not missing out on too much.

review:
Fortix 2 √© uma vers√£o levemente atualizada do primeiro, ent√£o se conhece ele j√° sabe o que esperar deste game, se n√£o conhece pode procurar minha analise para conhecer um pouco. Os dois valem a pena, mas se tivesse que escolher um seria este. Eu acho o pre√ßo desse jogo bem justo mesmo que ele seja bem curto (pode ser terminado em menos de duas horas).
------------------------------

Both are worth, but if I had to choose one it would be this. I think the price of this are fair, even if it is very short (can be finished in less than two hours).

author: {'steamid': '76561198194289627', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1490892488}
review:
Do you remember the old arcade game Qix? Of course you do - you grew up in the early 1980's arcades like i did. Fortix is a  lot like Qix, but about three or four levels of evolution beyond that. Your avatar's goal is to claim areas by moving (drawing lines) around them, while avoiding monsters and artillery which attack him. So long as he's on a claimed area, he's invulnerable, but claiming new areas requires sallying forth into danger. Played through the whole thing in only 2 sittings, but it's still got 3 more difficulty levels to get through. Playable with a single hand, though i highly recommend the keyboard for movement (arrow keys), rather than the mouse.

PS: was Linux support removed? Though i have it on Linux, the Store Page is no longer showing the system requirements for Linux. There's no indication of such in the product history.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970602587', 'num_games_owned': 6364, 'num_reviews': 3660, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1455338991}
review:
https://youtu.be/zBwJQaTxnHo

The basic formula from the original Fortix carries on into Fortix 2.  You draw lines to capture area on the play space in order to take down towers, capture dragons and secure objectives.

Fortix 2 doesn't add enough variety of gameplay or deviate far enough from the original game to distinguish itself.  Which causes it to feel like a map pack instead of a evolved sequel.

review:
Fortix 2, der zweite Teil der Reihe ist f√ºr meinen Geschmack etwas kurz geraten. 

Die Level sind fordernd aber nicht zu schwierig f√ºr Einsteiger - den ersten Teil muss man nicht gespielt haben um Fortix 2 zu verstehen. Fortix 2 ist in dem Sinne keine Fortsetzung, sondern ein eigenst√§ndiger Teil. Das Spiel erz√§hlt ohnehin keine spannende zusammenh√§ngende Geschichte. 

Zu empfehlen f√ºr Freunde von Gelegenheitsspielen und kurzweiliger Unterhaltung ohne Wiedereinstiegsschwierigkeiten nach l√§ngerer Pause. Eine ausgedehnte Pause legt man aber wahrscheinlich bei der L√§nge des Titels ohnehin nicht ein. Und wenn, f√§ngt man es nicht wieder an. 

Ich gebe einen Daumen hoch, weil der Preis verh√§ltnism√§√üig fair gehalten wurde zum Spielspa√ü!

author: {'steamid': '76561198103090723', 'num_games_owned': 3002, 'num_reviews': 344, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1404618716}
review:
A cute reverse tower defense game

Pro:
Graphics
Price
Cards & achieves
Demo
Low system spec
Often on sale
One of the few indie games that are actually good at release


Con:
And those promised DLCs are where?
After an hour and a half I was bored silly.
This is one of those games that just cries out for the workshop
Not as good as F1

Overall:
5/10 +2 demo, +1 price, +1 cards, +1 often on sale, -2 gets boring quickly = 8/10
For $2.19 less what you can sell the cards for, this is a fun way to pass an hour or so,

review:

Fortix 2 melhorou em muitos aspectos, os gr√°ficos est√£o muito melhores, as anima√ß√µes est√£o muito melhores, o level design est√° muito mais desafiador para o jogador e a trilha sonora deu uma leve melhorada tamb√©m. √â poss√≠vel tamb√©m selecionar antes da batalha n√£o um personagem (principal), mas tamb√©m outros, o qu√™ √© uma novidade. O jogo est√° muito mais colorido e vivo, diferente do t√≠tulo anterior que tinha um aspecto mais cinza e com cores menos vibrantes.

A dificuldade melhorou bastante (algumas partes s√£o frustrantes) e em termos de enredo, √© aquela mesma coisa: V√° com seu her√≥i salvar a tudo e a todos.

Fortix 2 est√° custando no atual momento, apenas 4 reais e me rendeu exatamente 4 horas de jogatina e divers√£o (e alguma frustra√ß√£o, √© claro).  Ent√£o n√£o tenho do que reclamar em rela√ß√£o ao pre√ßo do jogo.

Fortix 2 √© um belo t√≠tulo independente, que brilha por sua simplicidade e um pouco de desafio. Eu recomendo jogar o primeiro Fortix tamb√©m, que est√° saindo por menos de 2 reais aqui na Steam e apesar de ser menor e ter menos conquistas, √© tamb√©m um jogo excelente para passar o tempo.

O jogo ainda dropa cartas que s√£o vendidas por um √≥timo pre√ßo e tamb√©m tem v√°rias conquistas (algumas bem complicadas) para se fazer, ou seja ... quem √© amante e miletador de jogos aqui na Steam, vai gostar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031582331', 'num_games_owned': 6779, 'num_reviews': 767, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1440747921}
review:
This game in 5min
https://youtu.be/7NpN7cgfdKA

your greedy knight is back to take 17 more kingdoms (the 1st 12 are here also) 
you run around on lines that you "own" on the board and you take land by squaring it off.
dragons and towers will try to kill you when they find you off your land.
when you venture out some dragons will come at you and/or shoot fire at you.
there is also the towers that will fire on you, and bats when your destroy their den they follow your lines.
if any of these touch you or your line when your taking land your dead and the bat will just kill you if they touch you on your own land but can not follow you out.
water, cliffs, lava, sand, and some other obstacles will slow you down, then there are also impassable walls (dragons can fly over these).
castles also have locked gates and you'll have to "take" the key to unlock it.
if you take a catapult you'll launch a rock and take out one of the towers.
you win by destroying all enemies and/or taking key points on the map.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993567513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 292, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1439429731}
review:
It's a land grab/fence off to conquer game with a bit of bullet hell mixed in (avoid the enemies + projectiles). Nice visuals and sound, essentially no story. Keyboard is pretty necessary for refined controls though mouse is an option.

There are plenty of levels but the game is simple enough that you can brute force many levels by just bisecting the map in half. Since you're immune to most enemies/projectiles while not capturing new territory you can play it safe and take lots of tiny chunks until you reach the other side. Later on walls and gates often make it impossible to halve the map but it feels good when you can eliminate a bunch of things at once.

The things that change your approach are enemy locations, slowing terrain, impassable walls, locked gates/keys, and magic orbs (you can't capture land with one inside). There are also some timed powerups that can make levels a lot easier if you get them at the right time (like the ability to fly over walls).

There's also a zombie mode that I believe uses the same level terrain as the main mode but has the spin that you can be killed on the line and that zombies continually spawn from the gravestones (so you can get overwhelmed if you wait too long).

I haven't played this kind of game before (outside of maybe a Mario Party minigame?) so I found it fun enough to play through. Worth a look if you like action puzzlers although here you're mostly thinking about your route and the rest is execution.

Edit: For an alternate take on the land grab style, see Luminosity. You have a mouse-driven cursor and you click to shoot lines either up+down or left+right. You can't kill enemies by boxing them, just try to get enough land.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989183393', 'num_games_owned': 790, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1558814813}
review:
A fun little arcade game that is very much inspired by the classic Qix but adds enough new things to be a fun game of it's own. In Fortix 2 you are a single knight who bravely captures forts on his own by running around in circles, and while you are at it, kill some Ogres and Dragons too.

Overall it's just a fun game, it feels nice and responsive. I have not encountered any bugs my play. For the current price of ‚Ç¨1,99 I would definitly would recommend this if you like Qix.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055725979', 'num_games_owned': 1326, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 1143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1143, 'last_played': 1437338597}
review:
Otra idea brillante rescatada de ese pasado tan sabio.
Fortix 2 Supera en todo, como buena segunda parte, a Fortix.
Lo que m√°s valoro es que es diferente al original. No han hecho el mismo juego ampliandolo, si no que lo han retocado completamente, muy profesionalmente. El resultado es una segunda parte que se ha superado.

Muy recomendado para todo el mundo como juego a jugar. El nivel imposible es un verdadero reto que no es frustrante, por ello y para aprovechar el juego en todo su esplendor recomiendo completar los niveles en imposible. La dificultad ''Imposible'' significa que la computadora no es capaz de ganar el nivel, supongo.

Como se dice: una peque√±a joyita de los indies.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056789973', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1512, 'last_played': 1429683241}
review:
This game is highly addictive.
         It's top down, simple graphics and gameplay, but at impossible level...the game is challenging and fun. It plays something like the old tron motorcyles that leave a trail. You have to section off terrain to capture it, while being bombarded and attacked by dragons and such. Very fun.
         This is one of the only games I rage quit, but somehow I HAVE to get perfect score on impossible level. This game is worth every cent at full price, and if you get this on sale or in a bundle...you really should give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008452744', 'num_games_owned': 409, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1455574622}
review: A fantastic new version of Qix, Taito's classic 1981 arcade game. The well-realized fantasy theme, incorporating different terrain, walls, gates, towers, catapults, etc. allows for a lot of different objectives and ways to conquer each screen. Due to the nature of the gameplay, the keyboard works fine, but this game really needs to add controller support.

review:
Just got all the achievements for this game

Pros: Increases replay value with the Killing 300 dragons achievement even though it is a bit of a grind with there being a max of 3 to 4 dragons per stage. Allows you to play the classic (fortix 1) game playable. The zombie stages are challenging as well as the last stage itself

Cons: I would like to see an achievement or two for beating it on classic mode (aka fortix 1)

author: {'steamid': '76561197996720254', 'num_games_owned': 2069, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 1004, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1004, 'last_played': 1423646206}
review:
PROS: The visuals are nice for what it gives off, and the sound effect for capturing a dragon is great for what it is.  The puzzle idea behind it is solid, and works very well, the levels scaling in appropriate difficulty as it goes along.  Remakes of the levels from the original Fortix are also a nice touch.

CONS: The game doesn't do that much with some of the more interesting enemies in the later stages.  The music is rather forgettable.  The concept and strategy you use to complete one level can be used more or less to complete every level, and the increased difficulty only speeds up enemy attacks.  Zombie mode can also be a rather annoying pain, with no limit on the amount of zombies on screen.

ACHIEVEMENTS: Zombie mode will be a major problem in the later stages, and clearing every level on impossible without dying can be a pain.

FINAL: The game does what it intends to do, and stays in place for the run of it.  It's fun if you like field capture games, but as that's all it does, it's the kind of game you play for short runs to keep it from getting stale, and would be much better played on a portable or phone.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987514127', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1424639067}

author: {'steamid': '76561198000607162', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1565471146}
review:
Fun game, takes an old mechanic and adds some new things, like different type of enemies, powerups, and you don't win by capturing 100% of the scrren but by capturing specific targets. I particulary enjoyed a couple of achievements that required some thought and skill (finishing a level without using cannons and finishing a leven in less than 10 captures), I think a few more of this challenges would be nice, maybe as challenges included in the game and not only as achievements.
It's easy to understand and fun to play, recommended for anyone looking for some uncomplicated entertainment (it also includes classic levels, from Fortix 1, I assume).

author: {'steamid': '76561197987180715', 'num_games_owned': 756, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1282, 'last_played': 1420158989}
review: Fortix 2 is an upgrade in my opinion to classic Qix.  Why?  It has a storyline and more variance.  The game's concept is simple: you mark off pieces of land for capture.  However, when you are in the process of marking your captured land, you are vulnerable.  The top thrill in this game is deciding if/when to take calculated risks.  There are times where you'll be on the edge of your seat wondering if a cannon is going to fire just before you finish your newly captured area.  Of course there are subtle strategies here that you'll eventually figure out to make you a pro.  If you have never played Qix, pick this up as you should experience this style of game.  If you have played Qix, this game is an improvement.  Also, you don't need Fortix 1 as this game included Fortix 2 in its "classic" mode.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028274459', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 82, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1710091814}

Especially during sales when it can be bagged for a whistle and a backflip.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977345078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1421200500}
review:
This is Qix.  You remember that old arcade standby from the '80s that got like a million zillion remakes?  This is another one.  You use your cursor to carve off areas of the board until you have enough, then you move on to the next one.  Qix.

"Reverse turret defense game," they call it.  Dang it, Bobby...

author: {'steamid': '76561198061249750', 'num_games_owned': 1173, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 657, 'last_played': 1420690476}
review:
Built around a simple and novel idea, Fortix 2 is an example of a sequel done right. It doesn't change what made the first one so oddly enjoyable, even with its limited budget, keeping the "capture territory to win" mechanic, which acted as an interesting organic puzzle structure which allowed for many solutions, but is further built upon with more challenging layouts and obstacles to figure out. The main mechanic functions as thus; you're safe whenever you're running on your territory's border, but the moment you venture out, you become vulnerable to any projectiles and monsters roaming the land, including the borderlines you've drawn that have yet been connected to your territory. It's definitely unique, and there is a surprising amount of challenge and forethought that goes into each movement.
The artstyle has also come into its own, going away from the generic medival color pallete in the first game to have a more distinctive flush of primaries and a sharp art direction that adds serious identity to a series that was lacking in the first iteration. Whereas the first was muddily pixelated and blocky, the new 2d models and landscapes have a more cellshaded and smoothed look that is much easier on the eyes.
Five times the amount of content is provided here as well, including all the original levels of the first game, which basically negates a need to purchase the first one, and since this game is generally 2 dollars, there is no reason to feel a big risk in diving.
This game is not without its frustrations, as there are cheap deaths to be had and a lot of chance involved with making a perfect run, especially in later levels. It's not very involved either, and is easy to play while watching a show as well, but it keeps it from having any replay value once you've played through a level. It's always interesting to start a new level and facing their challeges, but once you're done there's very little to go back to. Ultimately, that is Fortix's downfall, but it is still a great bargain, and a charming little indie game to boot. Definitely check it out if you have some spare change and want something different for your gaming pallete.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012363945', 'num_games_owned': 2117, 'num_reviews': 404, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1699363144}
review:
Lovely little indie game with gameplay i have not experienced since Stix on Commodore 64. 

Gameplay in short: Run around and 'conquer' area by 'painting' until you have taken over the objectives in each mission. Watch out for bad guys and um... 'Greed is good' in this game as the more you try to grab the better if you can avoid the bad guys well enough. 

Only bad side is the obvious limitation to the game concept: eventually you have seen all enemy types and a  been there - done that feeling kicks in. At that point all you can do it crank the skill level up and play some moar.  Not that it matters that much because by the time you reach this you have already seen the best parts of the game and you can say it was a good buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081862874', 'num_games_owned': 188, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1412386952}
review:
Fortix 2 Review - Raymond K. Turcotte

When i first saw Fortix 2, i was dissapointed for many reasons. The Graphics were different, it's too colorful and it looks like a childs game. Now that i have returned to it, and avoided my previous opinion of the Game. It's somewhat enjoyable. It's not half bad actually. I like the fact that you can actually "Run" in this game rather then the first one. They also added keys, sheilds and New power ups. I understand that a "New" company took it over, 'I get it', i'm just a little sad about that. I love the first one, but not so much the second one. I myself wouldn't recommend this game. But i'm gonna say if you bought Fortix 1 first you will have the same opion as me. But hey' it's decent

I recommend this, if you haven't played the first one. If you have, you won't want to play this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973389214', 'num_games_owned': 1185, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1410677351}
review:
The painting of this game as "reverse tower defense" demonstrates an utter lack of understanding firstly of what tower defense means, and secondly, of the long and storied history of Qix and it's many many clones. 

Make no mistake, this game has nothing to do with the tower defense genre, and everything to do with being a shameless re-imagining of the classic 8-bit game Qix. That sounds like it would be a bad thing, but the truth is that Qix was a rad game when it released in 1981, and Fortix 2 truly feels like what would happen if the developers of Qix had time-traveled 30 years into the future at the start of development. 

Qix featured a simple mechanic, slickly implemented, with a presentation that was unremarkable but serviceable for its day. The exact same thing is true for Fortix 2. This is not a complicated game, but it is a great implementation of a simple mechanic. The difficulty curve is pitch-perfect, making finishing a level without losing any lives achievable but challenging. 

Fortix 2 isn't going to blow anyone away, but it does an excellent job of filling that spot in your Steam library for a game that doesn't ask for much in the way of investment, and can be consumed in 5-minute increments while still feeling rewarding, and for $2 or less, you can't really ask for more.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970897684', 'num_games_owned': 3191, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1420127324}
review: Fortix 2 is a direct sequel to Fortix. The gameplay is essentially the same. Graphics are improved and the maps are more challenging. One nice addition is you now have to collect keys to open the next part of the map. This makes each map longer and more difficult. The game has a high amount of replayability as you will want to get a "perfect" rating for each map. Addictive and a lot of fun, for $1.99 you will easily get a bunch of hours sunk into this little gem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041581459', 'num_games_owned': 1288, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1406763872}
review:
What can or should be said about this game? It is a descendant of Qix and Jeezball. Qix is a fairly old game that dates back from the 80s. Jeezball also dates from around the mid-80s. I wanted to like this game. You hope for some form of game progression that just never seems to develop. The levels get more difficult, but you stay the same. Of course, I do understand the point of this. It keeps the challenge up in the game. I am not a fan of the 1-hit-1-kill mechanic in a game like this. Yes, it is meant to be a press-your-luck type game, however there were times where I swear the hit detection was off. It seemed like the hitboxes were squares and not per-pixel collisions. Being wiped out because the box crossed your line is just irritating.

This is a difficult game to rate. Either you enjoy this type of game mechanic or you don't. I know this is said about a lot of games these days though, so I wonder if it should even be said at all. Graphically, the game has a nice aesthetic. The enemies and artillery are easy to spot. The sound is pretty basic though and easily forgotten. Overall if I had to give it a X on ten rating, I'd give it a 6.5.

I don't know when anything below a 8 or 9 meant a game was bad. It just means it is average. If you can pick it up on sale or in a bundle, I say go for it. However, be warned that the game play while varied due to the layout of the different levels does become monotonous.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007660137', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1398195028}
review:
Mehr Levels, mehr Steam-Errungenschaften und ein anderer Grafikstil als der erste Teil, aber im Grunde wieder das Gleiche. Hier gibt es noch Mauern und magische Barrieren die das Spiel hinausz√∂gern. 

Wer vom ersten Teil begeistert war, dem wird das wahrscheinlich wieder gefallen, aber keine Kaufempfehlung.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026325298', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1404254279}
review:
Score: 9/10

I bought this game for $0.44 and boy was I shocked how much I actually enjoyed it. This game brought me back to the days of playing Jezzball on Windows 95 when I was a kid. The fence in mechanic sounded like it would be awful until I had the realization that this was just a modern day Jezzball with fun cartoon graphics and more going on. This was a great way to bring that old mechanic back to life. I suggest doing a demo of the game and if you like it buy the thing its cheap as hell.

Un juego que lamentablemente es tan entretenido que hace que seas capaz de acabarlo en poco tiempo. Pocos graficos, los justos mejor dicho. author: {'steamid': '76561198111063610', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1144, 'last_played': 1599179259}

author: {'steamid': '76561198022970821', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1404938458}
review: On the one hand, it includes (all?) the levels from the original Fortix, along with new ones, so that should make it better merely by being a superset of it. On the other hand, the temporary spikes of input lag feel a little worse than I remember them being in the original Fortix, and I kind of preferred the "Ye Olde Fantasy" art style of the original Fortix to the generic cartooniness of this version. Still though, the gameplay is as engaging as ever, and the addition of keys and locks introduces a number of new strategies. Definitely worth a play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042110223', 'num_games_owned': 552, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1404792781}
review: Very inexpensive for the amount of enjoyment I've gottne out of it so far. I remember a game for the Sega Genesis(pretty sure it was Genesis, not another older system) called Ultimate Qix. I loved that game, and this is just like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090766605', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 721, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1590329266}
review: Qix was one of my favorite classic arcade games.  The Fortix games take the same basic concept and give it a medieval theme.  Fortix 2 isn't very deep, and it won't take long to finish it, but for the price it's a great value.  If you're trying to decide between Fortix 1 and 2, choose 2.  The improved graphics are worth the little bit of extra money, and Fortix 2's bonus levels are based on content from Fortix 1.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972196713', 'num_games_owned': 1763, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 658, 'last_played': 1403629309}
review: This is the follow on to the first Fortix game so there is a continuation of the story line from the first as well. Not that it is really deep in any sense of the word. Those veterans of the first game will see a graphics update which makes it look different but in a  good way. The gameplay mechanics are the same but the enemies have a few new tricks that will be thrown in play so that makes it not so much a rehash of the first game but an evolution it the game itself. There is plenty to keep you busy and like the first game can be played at your leisure at home or at work. Also as with the first, Fortix 2 gets my recommendation. I had a good time playing this and I believe you will too.

review:
La premisa de Fortix 2 es, siendo claros, simple, sencilla, y a si bien a primeras parece aburrida, es sin duda poco a poco un reto que se disfruta del primer al √∫ltimo momento. 

El aspecto art√≠stico es bastante bonito, la jugabilidad es simple y directa, pero no por ello menos gratificante, la banda sonora no es nada del otro mundo, pero est√° perfectamente adecuada a lo que ves en pantalla y a como el juego pretende hacerte sentir.

Aprobado.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970514928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 842, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1404423469}
review: Highly recommended. A knights and dragons twist on the old Qix game mechanic, with tower defense thrown in for good measure and plenty of other interesting variables. Tactical complexity for a very simple concept. Much replay value.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972667799', 'num_games_owned': 626, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1935, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1352, 'last_played': 1546326432}
review: This game is so simple and fun! It is my go to game when I have a few minutes of down time. The basic premise is to make the boxes with the line behind you without getting hit. The hardest difficulty is intense. If it's on sale, get it! It has an updated version of the first game in it as well. It's practically two for the price of one!

author: {'steamid': '76561198065124176', 'num_games_owned': 260, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1406280488}
review:
This game is much fun. Easy to learn, probably easy to master too. Not very time consuming, so it's good for you that need mini game in your coffee break :D

Pros:
For only $1,99 this game has a good graphics
The monster/ enemy variation are good
Unique gameplay

Cons:
I think AI development is not so good, that makes this game little boring, once you mastered the strategy, you just need a patience to complete this game
As a strategy/ puzzle game, the puzzle itself need to improve
The storyline is also very shallow

The developer should improve this game, especially on the storyline, AI, and game mechanic. This game is so potential, because just a few game that have the gameplay like this.

Anyway, good job developer. I like this kind of game.

Juego simple pero entretenido que mejora, como deber√≠a de ser, a su predecesor.
(Se agradece poder bloquear la sal√≠da de l√≠nea de nuestro personaje).

Lo adquir√≠ por curiosidad y debido a que me recordaba a un juego de recreativa con chicas ligeritas de ropa como fondo de pantalla.

Y la verdad, el juego cumple.
La relaci√≥n calidad/precio es aceptable.

review: Fortix 2 ist eine Mischung aus point to klick und Arcade Spiel, zum Zeitvertreib ein gelungenes Spiel, in die Meta Kategorie w√ºrde ich es jedoch nicht einordnen. Die Grafikqualit√§t ist f√ºr das Erscheinungsjahr und des Herstellers auf einem guten Mittelma√ü.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976064139', 'num_games_owned': 1120, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1044, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 889, 'last_played': 1416225703}
review: Addictive!  Couldn't put down the 1st one and the little enhancements put into Fortix 2 were just right.  Don't mess with a good thing.  There's frustrations in this one - but it's a fun game that keeps your attention.  A casual game to chip away at.  Pick it up with ease.  Controls are simple and accurate.  Multiple difficulties and acheivements will keep the replay value high - perfect for a casual game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058069187', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1460202558}
review: A cheap to buy game with trading cards the graphics and sound do their job and the gameplay is quite fun while it lasts.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988257417', 'num_games_owned': 1682, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1393756544}
review:
PROS

- Quality graphics style and illustration
- Very cheap at 2$

CONS

- Boring

REVIEW

Original gameplay, and certeinly so cheap that price is not an issue, but it remains too simple to be worth the time.

The main problem is that the more you advance in missions, the more the single tactic will be to inch forward towards your objective and any tactic or strategy becomes obsolete. Things will shoot at you and move towards you too fast to let you do anything clever, and the inching forward process is very boring, at least to me. This game is empty of any strategy whatsoever, no thinking required.

Not recommended. At least watch a let's play video before buying this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041604790', 'num_games_owned': 370, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1391259086}
review:
A great idea made into an excellent little game. For the few hours that I played it to beat the first difficulty, I enjoyed my time very much. Now, I was a fan of the first Fortix, so I knew that this would be no different. 

Fortix 2 is also a great game to play in short bursts, so if you want a quick break from whatever you're doing - this is great!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035410301', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1688514406}
review:
Not quite sure why this game is addictive. If your the kind of person who has to have 3 stars on every level of angry birds.... this  is the OC game for you. The thing that keeps me playing this game is getting those darn 3 stars to match for every level. 

Gameplay:
Use WASD or Arrow Keys to move around.
Capture Land by connecting lines
Repeat until you get 3 stars on every level!

Nice change of pace from my shooters and RTS games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034306439', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1755, 'last_played': 1410522933}
review: Very simple design but lots of fun. Good playability on harder levels. Zombie mode for an extra hour of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962820885', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1390766258}
review: This is better than Fortix so you can just skip the first game. It's a mission-based Qix that's better than it has any right to be. At 3 hours, it ends just before it gets stale. At $2, it's a no brainer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018302427', 'num_games_owned': 769, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 2208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2208, 'last_played': 1390238265}
review:
I used to play a simlar game on the SNES called Bizzy Land. This is basicly that without the childish element. (or more commonly refered to as a Qix clone).
One of the unique elements of Fortix is tower defence style it has or it. 
Capture a tower to destroy it, or capture a cannon to destroy the tower, and capture the territories symbolised by a red flag to win the level. All the while avoiding dragons and the towers shooting at you.

Great casual fun, easy to play when you have just a few minuets to spare.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076604412', 'num_games_owned': 1750, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1617848895}
review:
Como a pr√≥pria pequena an√°lise descrita da venda do jogo, voc√™ √© Sir Fortix, o cavaleiro que deve conquistar "castelos" (que seriam √°reas em formas de escudo pelo mapa do jogo), enquanto foge de:
1 - Balas de canh√£o arremessadas pelas torres espalhadas pelo mapa, que j√° digo de passagem, pegam a tela inteira, e s√≥ (e j√° t√° de bom tamanho viu, hehehe);
2 - Drag√µes de toda esp√©cie e cor: verdes, brancos, drag√µes esqueletos, pretos. Que s√≥ perambulam pelo mapa, que soltam bolas de fogo, que soltam bolas de fogo triplas, vixe, √© um horror ! ;
3 - Bat-cavernas (?) que soltam morceguinhos que ficam te perseguindo pra todo lado;
4 - Fora o pr√≥prio ambiente, que inclui lava, areia movedi√ßa, mar, √°gua, terra, espinhos, bolotas que n√£o te deixam completar o seu caminho, muros...
Bem, mas como isso tudo te atrapalha e como √© a porcaria do jogo, voc√™ me pergunta ?
√â assim, voc√™ √© um "ponto", vamos assim dizer, que desenha uma linha em um mapa, que seria a tela que voc√™ v√™ no jogo, e conforme voc√™ fecha essas linhas, formando por exemplo um quadrado, n√£o perfeito, pois voc√™ precisa voltar ao ponto inicial de onde partiu, essas linhas, v√£o fechando o mapa...
Iiiiii, que coisa besta !
Nadaaaaaaaaaaaaaa, √© muito viciante ! √â como se voc√™ estivesse raspando uma dessas raspadinhas de loteria, e assim voc√™ vai vendo o que tem por baixo, completando o mapa, at√© o seu objetivo total, que seriam os castelos do come√ßo da an√°lise.
Fecha o pacote um mundar√©u de conquistas, placar online, jogabilidade simples e prazerosa e o que eu considero o melhor, pra um jogo casual como esse, o pre√ßo √© espetacular.
√â um pouco frustante l√° pelo final do jogo, porque as fases v√£o ficando consideravelmente dif√≠ceis, mas mesmo assim, √© um √≥timo jogo.
Poderia ter gr√°ficos um pouco melhores, efeitos de luz, part√≠culas, blablabla, mas pelo que ele oferece e pelo pre√ßo, considero um √≥timo custo/benef√≠cio.
Nota ? 07/10, por ser o que √© !
Recomendo !!!

review:
Fun game, Easy to play.
Reminds me of an upgraded version of the 1980's arcade game called Qix.
It's worth the $1.99

If enemies touch you/your line while your making a new line you die...Pretty simple conecept.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064156757', 'num_games_owned': 3338, 'num_reviews': 380, 'playtime_forever': 25907, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4320, 'last_played': 1670235755}
review:
Fortix 2 is best described as a reverse turret defense game. As Sir Fortix, the knight, you must conquer castles while dodging tower turrets and evil monsters. 

Fight your way across the shires of the island Artalom, storming from castle to castle. Use cunning strategy to succeed against the maze-like levels and defeat the evil mage Xitrof. 

You are the lone Knight who must fight against the entire infested continent!

author: {'steamid': '76561198028312145', 'num_games_owned': 590, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1390159619}

author: {'steamid': '76561198067980135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1568, 'last_played': 1388065730}
review: Fortix √® davvero un bel passatempo, molto sottovalutato e snobbato da molti per il prezzo decisamente basso ed anche per il genere ovviamente, ma non ha nulla da invidiare ad altri giochi dato che il suo dovere lo fa, pure bene aggiungerei, ovvero divertire! In questa seconda versione, a parte le solite meccaniche di conquista del territorio, √® stata aggiunta qualche miglioria in pi√π, come la possibilit√† di correre lungo il perimetro segnato, quindi velocizzare i tempi di completamento, grafica rivisitata in stile fumettoso ed anche una modalit√† segreta (che dovrete sbloccare da soli, quindi niente spoiler). Quindi c'√® tanta roba da fare, infatti se il primo capitolo √® apparso ostico al livello impossibile, con questo c'√® da tirar gi√π i santi dal calendario, ma la soddisfazione di finirlo tutto √® davvero una gran cosa ;) Costa poco, quindi fatevi un bel regalino :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197970286203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1387943823}
review:
It's basically exactly the same as Fortix 1, which is to say a super-budget Qix clone that's somewhat more forgiving than the original Qix, but in the end it's still Qix, and there's roughly a million billion Qix clones out there. Some of them are even porno, which is nice if you like seeing naked ladies. You generally have to cheat in those though because they were designed as super-duper quarter munc¬≠hers, for obvious reasons.

The music doesn't seem as good as Fortix 1's but I'm not about to waste thirty seconds of my life re-downloading Fortix 1 to actually compare the music, for all I know it's exactly the same as Fortix 1's but now I'm just desensitized to it.

It's not offensively horrible or anything, the price is nice and if you like Qix you'll like this, but don't expect Super Deep Multifaced Tactical Simulator 7: More Facets, More Tactics XP (Roguelike Sandbox Edition).

author: {'steamid': '76561198009585682', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1312786800}
review:
Bien que Fortix soit un jeu de type "Tower Offense", √† savoir l'inverse d'un "Tower Defense", il repose aussi sur une m√©canique de jeu qui n'est pas sans rappeler le v√©n√©rable jeu Qix.

Dans ce jeu, vous incarnez Sir Fortix, un chevalier qui part √† la conqu√™te de ch√¢teaux, mais qui doit √©viter les tirs ennemis et les monstres sur son chemin. Il devra litt√©ralement se frayer un chemin √† travers une trentaine de niveaux labyrinthiques, afin de vaincre le mage Xitrof. Pour ce faire, il pourra tracer des lignes qui lui permettront de r√©cup√©rer petit √† petit des parcelles de terrain, des tourelles ennemies, des balistes et des ch√¢teaux. Vous pourrez √©galement r√©cup√©rer divers bonus temporaires, qui auront pour effet de pauser les ennemis , de vous permettre de voler, etc.

Cette technique de capture d√©coule du jeu d'arcade Qix, paru il y a 30 ans. Le jeu comporte un bestiaire plus √©labor√© que son pr√©d√©cesseur et permet de sprinter sur les trac√©s existants. Les joueurs seront d√©sormais ralentis par certains types de terrains et d√©fenses. Si compl√©ter les 30 niveaux du jeu vous demandera un peu moins de quatre heures, compl√©ter le jeu aux niveaux de difficult√© plus √©lev√©s constituera un d√©fi certain, en particulier si vous d√©sirez obtenir une note parfaite au terme de chaque conqu√™te. Et lorsque vous aurez compl√©t√© la campagne principale, vous pourrez toujours compl√©ter 15 niveaux tir√©s du premier titre de la s√©rie. Des extensions sont √† venir, de m√™me que des mises √† jour mensuelles.

Jeu disponible en fran√ßais (textes √† l'√©cran seulement)

Points positifs:

+ Combinaison heureuse de genres
+ Niveaux de difficult√© bien dos√©s
+ Support de Steam Cloud

Points n√©gatifs:

- O√π sont les mises √† jour mensuelles?

author: {'steamid': '76561198006636652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 503, 'last_played': 1382049461}
review:
It's better the Fortix 2, but sadly doesn't bring much new with it.
The best feature is the "Run" function, which helps cover the map as well as keeping you from running a line when you don't want to.

It's maddeningly difficult on Impossible, which is good, but frustrating.
There's some hidden features as well that brings in even more hours of playtime.

Fortix 2 is better then the first, but i'd wish it bring more new things to the table. It's prettier and larger and a cheap game.
Casual fun, i can recommend this (but keep that anger controlled!).

author: {'steamid': '76561197995330335', 'num_games_owned': 1096, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1388241536}
review:
"Fortix 2 is best described as a reverse turret defense game", claims the store page. Well, no -- it's more accurate to say that Fortix is a Qix clone.
That's not a bad thing, though. I had been looking for a quick Qix fix for a while, and didn't find much save for an extravagantly priced "update" on XBLA (¬£11 with DLC, and it's ugly and short to add insult to injury).

In Qix/Fortix, you move on the periphery of the game arena. Leaving that periphery leaves you vulnerable, but that's how you conquer terrain: once you have traced a line dividing the non-conquered map in 2, the smaller half becomes yours. Basic risk/reward system: the payoff for tracing a long line is potentially high, but getting greedy is how you'll die most of the time.
Fortix 2 brings some variation to that classic formula and wraps the whole thing in cute graphics. I recommend it to fans of the classic Taito game or anyone looking for a chill arcade game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051887652', 'num_games_owned': 875, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1374597664}
review:
Once upon a time (1981!), there was a famous arcade game called Qix. More than 25 years later, a Hungarian indie team of developers used Qix as inspiration to make their own game: Fortix. As it was successful, the devs released a sequel called Fortix 2. Today I made a review of it.

I'll explain gameplay for those people who haven't played Fortix 1/2 yet or don't know what the game is about, if you've already played them feel free to skip this paragraph. Gameplay is simple; levels are boxes, inside of where you must draw lines (and complete shapes) to capture terrain, and this way you must capture all the dark badges in the level to complete it.

Of course it's not going to be that easy, and, as the levels advance, you'll have to face cannon-bullet shooting turrets, different kind of dragons, ogres, and more. The guys that already played Fortix 1 (like me) will find that the number of enemies has grown for good. There are also new game mechanics, like having to capture a key to open its door, running faster (if you are in the border lines), having a power-up that lets you fly or capturing flowers to get some extra points and things like that.

Let's move onto visual aspect. This second game has got by far better graphics, animations and sound than the original. Levels look full of life, and music helps to feel that too. Everything is beautiful, even the main menu.

This game starts 3 years after the end of Fortix 1. Back then, we fought bravely against the evil Xitrof, defeated him, and put him in a place were he shouldn't bother us anymore. But, disasters happen, and he escaped and sailed to a foreign island, where the new levels are set; you'll have to fight him again.

Getting all the achievements in Fortix 1 was a challenge, and this sequel brings almost twice the number of achievements that the first one had. You'll have a good time trying to unlock them all.

If you've already played Fortix 1 and you enjoyed it a bit, give it a try (same goes if you really liked it). But I can't recommend the first game to someone who has already played the second, as Fortix 2 is a much better game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009986252', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1322553600}
review:
A fun little puzzle game in the vein of the classic Qix.

Like Lightfish and the aforementioned Qix, the Fortix games revolve around a simple concept. You control a character around a square playing field, and the object is to capture chunks of the field by venturing out from the border, drawing a shape, and reconnecting either to the line you were drawing or the original border.

The challenge is to do so without the various enemies and obstacles touching the lines you are in the process of drawing.

The original Fortix was also plenty good, but of the two, this successor has upgraded visuals and some new fun gameplay tweaks and enhancements that give it a slight edge.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027546755', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 733, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 733, 'last_played': 1375513902}
review:
Fortix 2 continues the great formula of the original Fortix and enhances it with more of everything: Levels, enemies, power-ups, achievements, characters and features.

The game features 30 brand new levels and additionally contains 15 revisited levels of the original Fortix. Upon using a small 'trick' in the main menu, you also unlock the Zombie mode in which you have to fight your way through the levels by capturing zombies (Duh!).

Additionally you can chose between 5 different (partly unlockable through earning achievements) playable characters such as a hooligan, a tank or the original knight.

Of course the game features an online leaderboard where you can compete with other people and your friends for the best highscore.

The playtime to finish the 30 main levels (when going for a 'Perfect!' run) should be around 6-8 hours. The revisited levels, Zombie mode and other difficulty levels provide a huge replayability, so you can easily spend dozens of hours on this game.

Great fun!
