author: {'steamid': '76561197982210220', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1379216446}
review:
Fortix 2 improves upon the arcade-strategy formula of the original Fortix, and adds a few new twists to the gameplay. The new game has maps that really force you to rethink your gameplay style.

Fortix 2 also features a better menu interface. One that is comfortable to use on the PC - a problem that the first game had.

Fortix 2 includes the maps from Fortix, although gameplay is subtly different in this version (specifically: the way that you capture castles has changed). The first game gives you a lot of gameplay for just $0.99, but if you like, you can skip the original and play its levels in Fortix 2.

Good game! I really enjoy playing this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996763361', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 533, 'last_played': 1382199484}

author: {'steamid': '76561197961275725', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1327737600}
review: Fortix 2 is a Qix-style game with a cartoonish fantasy aesthetic. More importantly, it's honestly -fun-. A variety of enemy types, each with their own AI, from the slow and stupid ogre to the conquer-line sniffing undead dragon, terrain types to slow or even stop your progress when you cross it, and power-ups to mitigate the effect of the former two make each level a wholly unique challenge. With on-line leaderboards and multiple difficulty levels, this simple game has the potential for a lot of staying power.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024958741', 'num_games_owned': 1504, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 810, 'last_played': 1313478000}
review:
A simple, fun action game, reminiscent of light-cycle duel (Tron) and/or that old windows game where you divide the screen to isolate bouncing balls, but made into a fantasy setting. Huh. Tough to describe, but a lot of fun for the 10 - 15 hrs you will likely play it.

A good 'netbook game'.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009156904', 'num_games_owned': 756, 'num_reviews': 278, 'playtime_forever': 942, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 867, 'last_played': 1374598651}
review: Although Fortix 2 still has the same gameplay as the first game, it got a HUGE improvements from the first one, new graphics, new monsters, new towers, new obstacles and ZOMBIES!!!! I'll recommend the same as I did in the first Fortix. If you love to perfectly complete everything in every levels, every difficulty and every achievements and/or love the first game, then you can't miss this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979084213', 'num_games_owned': 4492, 'num_reviews': 1009, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1374744262}
review:
Excellent casual game. Really addictive. You're a knight who has to create shapes inside a giant rectangle. Once you see it in action, you know what sort of game this is. I'm sure everyone has played a clone of this game at least once in his/her life. In fact, know the old Snake game (no, not Metal Gear Solid, you fool) ? The gameplay is similar to this game, except this is a bit more feature packed. Excellent graphics, good music, addictive gameplay. We have a winner here !

[Rating: 72/100]

author: {'steamid': '76561197990566008', 'num_games_owned': 2099, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1662956108}
review: Another suprise favorite for me.  Anyone else old enought to remember of an old arcade game Qix, or Jezzball, will find this game to be very similar.  It's not just a clone, they have evolved the Qix formula to include capture points instead of the simple percentage land grabs.  The game starts out too easy but quickly ramps up the difficulty and there is a secret zombie mode to double your playtime.  What have you got to loose give the demo a go!

author: {'steamid': '76561197981047937', 'num_games_owned': 7422, 'num_reviews': 437, 'playtime_forever': 733, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 733, 'last_played': 1374551785}
review: It's the original Fortix (Qix clone) with slightly more balanced difficulty. Impossible is no longer nearly as insane, and I don't even want to think about Easy now. Art style's adorable, it's cute and entertaining and one heck of a lot of fun. Try the demo and if you like it, get the whole package. (I wholeheartedly recommend it all.)

author: {'steamid': '76561197966896320', 'num_games_owned': 10151, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 1576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1576, 'last_played': 1375097972}
review:
Let me start with a quick compare: Fortix took me 4,9 hours to finish 100% - Fortix 2 took me 15,9 hours (you can remove perhaps 4 hours or so since I spent some time trying to figure out the secret achievements). Compared to Fortix there's a few improvements e.g. some new creatures and better level design. Also, if you're going for perfect you can replay a single castle instead of doing all 2-3 again (well, perhaps it doesn't make that much sense then to group them but it's still nice).

I thought the price of fortix was a bit expensive since it was pretty short (NOTE: the price has been droppen to 0,99‚Ç¨!!!), but, imo, the 6,99‚Ç¨ price tag for Fortix 2 fits pretty well.

One last note: impossible difficulty might not be the hardest mode in this game, but you'll need to discover that yourself ;-)
